title: Paragon Bank offers best-buy fixed-rate savings bonds
text:
18.60 +0.05 
Challenger bank Paragon (Xetra: 555869 - news ) now tops the fixed-rate bond tables for one, two, three and five years 
Paragon Bank has launched new best-buy two and three-year fixed-rate savings bonds, overtaking the current leading rates by a sliver. 
The new two-year fix pays 2.34pc, up from 2.2pc, while the three year version has risen from 2.31pc to 2.66pc. 
Both accounts can only be opened online with a minimum of £1,000. 
• Renault's RCI Bank offers best-buy easy-access savings rate 
= Verdict = 
Paragon has narrowly claimed top spot for both terms. The two-year pips Secure Trust Bank (2.33pc), while the three-year bond beats Charter Savings Bank (2.65pc). 
The bank now has best-buys across all fixed-rate bond terms except four years, which is held by Charter Savings Bank and its offer of 2.75pc. Earlier this month Paragon Bank launched the best-buy rates for one and five-year bonds. 
Susan Hannums, from rate-monitoring site SavingsChampion.co.uk, said: “Paragon Bank is making a name for itself with this type of aggressive pricing, giving two of the most recent active providers in the best buy tables, Secure Trust Bank and Charter Savings Bank, a run for their money.”
